Recommendation.Name: Petronas Twin Tower
Recommendation.Description: Petronas Twin Towers are the tallest twin towers in the world, and its status has remained unchallenged since 1996.
Attraction: Explore everything from space-age exhibits to fossils.
Driving a life-size Sauber PETRONAS Formula One racing car
Experience cage rage and dive with shark

Recommendation.Name: KL Tower
Recommendation.Description: KL Tower is a 421-meter-tall telecommunication tower in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. It is the world's seventh-tallest tower. The upper area of the tower contains a revolving restaurant, providing diners with a panoramic view of the city. There are some interesting activities to participate in the tower.
Attraction: Enjoy the thrilling experience at KL Tower SKY BOX
Spectacular views of KL City skyline day and night
Challenged your self to the Tower Walk 100 at the edge of KL Tower
Get the best view of Kuala Lumpur from the KL Tower Malaysia Observation Deck

Recommendation.Name: Batu Caves
Recommendation.Description: Batu Caves is a mogote with a series of limestone caves. The cave complex consists many Hindu temples. The complex also hosts a 43 m high Murugan statue, one of the largest Murugan statues in the world.
Attraction: Enjoy the hourly dance performances, statues, and shrines

Recommendation.Name: Little India and Chinatown
Recommendation.Description: Little India is home to the beloved mamak culture, food stalls that serve a delicious fusion of Malay and Tamil dishes. Chinatown serves local favorites such as Hokkien mee, Ikan Bakar, asam laksa, and curry noodles.
Attraction: Enjoy traditional tea and Indian snacks
Discovering more about the Indian and Chinese community and their beliefs

Promotion.Title: Mother Day In KL
Promotion.Description: Plan a magical Mother's Day in KL! Free trip planner & unforgettable memories
